meanings.definition: The ringing or sound of bells.
meanings.sent1: The tintinnabulation of the church bells filled the air with joy.
meanings.sent2: I woke up to the sweet tintinnabulation of wind chimes outside my window.
meanings.sent3: The cat's collar created a comical tintinnabulation as it ran around the house.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a tintinnabulation of happiness in the quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The distant tintinnabulation of sleigh bells brought back memories of childhood winters.

meanings.sent1: The delicate tintinnabulation of the tiny bells was enchanting.
meanings.sent2: The stream made a soft tintinnabulation as it flowed over the pebbles.
meanings.sent3: The wind carried the tintinnabulation of laughter from the playground.
meanings.sent4: The distant tintinnabulation of a music box echoed through the room.
meanings.sent5: The gentle tintinnabulation of the wind chimes soothed her restless mind.

meanings.sent1: The tintinnabulation of the church bells signaled the start of the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The joyful tintinnabulation of the wedding bells filled the town square.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected tintinnabulation of the fire alarm startled everyone in the building.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic tintinnabulation of the handbell choir captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The solemn tintinnabulation of the funeral bells echoed through the village.
